facts: Football (soccer) is played by two teams of 11 players, including one goalkeeper on each team.
A standard soccer match has two 45-minute halves, and extra time can be added to make up for stoppages.
Players are not allowed to use their hands or arms to control the ball, except goalkeepers inside their own penalty area.
The offside rule helps prevent players from staying near the opponentâ€™s goal waiting for an easy pass.
A penalty kick is taken from 11 meters (12 yards) away after certain fouls happen inside the penalty area.
The FIFA World Cup is the biggest international soccer tournament and is held every four years.
A yellow card is a warning for breaking rules, and a red card means the player must leave the game immediately.
